intro: Tylophora adalinae, commonly known as the Adalina's tylophora, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its slender stems, opposite leaves, and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
